question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Transactions Count Overflow] At line 77, transactions_count is added to starting_version, but can None handling cause expected_end_version to be incorrectly None later? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [GRPC Client Creation] At line 106, create_grpc_client() can fail, but is error handling sufficient if fullnode is unreachable? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Request Configuration] At lines 107-110, GetTransactionsFromNodeRequest is created with user-provided values, can malicious values cause server-side DoS or errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Transaction Count Check] At line 189, exactly 1000 transactions are required, but can edge cases at ledger end have fewer transactions causing valid data to be rejected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Version Alignment Check] At line 191, starting version must be divisible by 1000, but can valid transaction batches starting at non-aligned versions be rejected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() worker tasks] [Sequential Version Check] At lines 194-198, versions must be sequential, but can reorgs or gaps in the blockchain cause valid data to fail validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Transaction Retrieval] At line 343, get_transactions(version, 1) retrieves 1 batch, but does '1' mean 1 batch of 1000 or 1 transaction, causing validation inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate() worker tasks] [Iter Enumerate] At line 344, transactions are iterated with enumerate, but can empty transaction sets cause the loop to never execute hiding validation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Init Frame Validation] At lines 160-168, only StatusType::Init is accepted as first frame, but can the fullnode send Init multiple times causing state confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Response Type Matching] At line 277, response type is matched as Data or Status, but can unknown response types cause panic if protobuf schema changes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Status Type Validation] At line 287, only BatchEnd status is expected during processing, but can other status types (Init, Error) be sent mid-stream causing incorrect behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Transaction Ordering] At lines 280-284, transactions are inserted into BTreeMap by version, but if fullnode sends them out of order, will BTreeMap ordering guarantee correct batch formation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Partial Batch Handling] Comment at line 282 mentions partial batches, but if a batch is split across multiple Data responses, can the buffer assembly logic cause gaps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Exit Without Cleanup] At line 101, exit(0) is called if backfill is already done, but are resources (file handles, network connections) properly cleaned up? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [Exit During Processing] At line 254, exit(0) is called when ending_version is reached, but can in-flight uploads be lost if workers haven't finished? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate()] [Exit Without Validation] At line 321, exit(0) is called if validation is already done, but is this check reliable or can it be bypassed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [No Graceful Shutdown] The backfill loop at line 265 has no shutdown mechanism, can SIGTERM or other signals leave data in inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate()] [Task Join Failures] At line 382, task await can propagate errors, but if one task fails, do other tasks get cancelled or do they continue processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() progress task] [Context Macro] At lines 243-246, context() is used for error handling, but can these errors be recovered from or do they always terminate the process? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill() stream loop] [Error Logging] At line 271, errors are logged before panic, but is there any telemetry or alerting to detect malicious activity patterns? (Low)
